title: Internationalization (i18n)
subject: Angular
theory: Angular has efficient built-in support for multiple languages. You mark text with `i18n`, extract it to an XML file (XLIFF), translate it, and build separate versions of the app for each locale.

examples.explanation: The @@id allows you to keep the same ID even if text changes.

interview_questions.question: How does Angular i18n work at build time?
interview_questions.answer: It generates separate bundles for each language (Merge Translation), meaning zero runtime performance cost for translation lookup.

real_world_use_cases.description: Serving en-US, fr-FR, and es-ES versions of the same store.

exam_notes: i18n attribute is removed at build time.
Date/Currency pipes auto-format based on LOCALE_ID.
summary: Angular's i18n approach prioritizes performance by baking translations in at compile time.
